title: Jalapeño Cheddar Cornbread
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C) on regular bake setting with rack centered. Lightly grease a 10-inch cast-iron skillet.
Place diced jalapeños in the hot skillet for 5 minutes. Remove and cool in a bowl. Return skillet to oven to preheat.
Whisk together flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl. Set aside.
In a 2-cup measuring cup, combine cooked corn with cream or milk until reaching the 1½ cup mark (355ml total).
In a medium bowl, lightly beat eggs. Add the corn-cream mixture and cheddar cheese. Stir together.
In a large bowl, mix butter and sugar until butter absorbs the sugar.
Add egg mixture and combine. Stir in cooled jalapeños.
Fold in flour mixture gently until barely incorporated.
Remove skillet from oven and coat with nonstick spray. Spoon batter into hot pan.
Bake 25-28 minutes until golden brown and springy to touch.
Cool in pan at least 30 minutes before serving.
notes: Volume conversions: 1¼ cups flour ≈ 150g, 1 cup cornmeal ≈ 140g, 1 tbsp baking powder ≈ 12g, 1½ tsp salt ≈ 7g, 4 eggs ≈ 200g, ¾-1 cup jalapeños ≈ 120g, 1 cup corn ≈ 150g, ½ cup cream ≈ 120g, 1 cup cheese ≈ 113g, ¾ cup butter ≈ 170g, ⅓-⅔ cup sugar ≈ 100g
Reduce salt if using salted butter
Can reheat covered with foil at 350°F for 8-10 minutes
Cast iron skillet creates best crust
